definition: A term commonly used to refer to a specific anatomical structure in the human body, typically found in females. It serves as a passage or canal that separates and connects two distinct areas within the body.

examples.german: Die Scheide des Schwertes ist beschädigt.
examples.english: The sheath of the sword is damaged.

examples.german: Die Scheide des Messers ist aus Leder.
examples.english: The sheath of the knife is made of leather.

examples.german: Sie steckte den Brief in die Scheide des Umschlags.
examples.english: She inserted the letter into the envelope's sheath.

examples.german: Die Scheide des Stiftes schützt die Spitze.
examples.english: The sheath of the pen protects the tip.

examples.german: Der Dolch wurde aus seiner Scheide gezogen.
examples.english: The dagger was drawn from its sheath.
